Imports

materials, world, cameras, geometry, colors, transformations, shapes, hdrimages, lights

Types

GrammarError = object of CatchableError
An error found by the lexer/parser while reading a scene file 
InputStream = object
  stream*: Stream
  location*: SourceLocation
  savedChar*: char
  savedLoc*: SourceLocation
  tabulations: int
  savedToken: Option[Token]
A high-level wrapper around a stream, used to parse scene files. This type implements a wrapper around a stream, with the following additional capabilities:
  • It tracks the line number and column number;
  • It permits to "un-read" characters and tokens.
KeywordEnum = enum
  NEW = "new", MATERIAL = "material", PLANE = "plane", SPHERE = "sphere",
  DIFFUSE = "diffuse", SPECULAR = "specular", UNIFORM = "uniform",
  CHECKERED = "checkered", IMAGE = "image", IDENTITY = "identity",
  TRANSLATION = "translation", ROTATIONX = "rotationX", ROTATIONY = "rotationY",
  ROTATIONZ = "rotationZ", SCALING = "scaling", CAMERA = "camera",
  ORTHOGONAL = "orthogonal", PERSPECTIVE = "perspective", FLOAT = "float",
  LIGHT = "light"
Enumeration for all the possible keywords recognized by the lexer 
Scene = object
  materials*: Table[string, Material]
  world*: World
  camera*: Option[Camera]
  floatVariables*: Table[string, float]
  overriddenVariables*: HashSet[string]
A scene read from a scene file 
SourceLocation = object
  fileName*: string ## the name of the file, or the empty string if there is no file associated with this location
                    ##  (e.g., because the source code was provided as a memory stream, or through a network connection)
  lineNum*: int              ## number of the line (starting from 1)
  colNum*: int               ## number of the column (starting from 1)
A specific position in a source file 
Token = object
  token*: TokenValue         ## A lexical token, used when parsing a scene file
  location*: SourceLocation  ## The location of the token
  
TokenType = enum
  keyword, identifier, literalNumber, literalString, symbol, stopToken
TokenValue = object
  case kind*: TokenType
  of keyword:
    keywords*: KeywordEnum   ## A token containing a keyword
  of identifier:
    idWord*: string          ## A token containing an identifier
  of literalNumber:
    litNum*: float           ## A token containing a literal number
  of literalString:
    litString*: string       ## A token containing a literal string
  of symbol:
    sym*: char               ## A token containing a symbol
  of stopToken:
    stop*: char              ## A token signalling the end of a file

Consts

SYMBOLS = ['(', ')', '<', '>', '[', ']', '*', ',']
WHITESPACE = [' ', '\t', '\n', '\r']

Procs

proc `$`(loc: SourceLocation): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Stringify procedure for SourceLocation type 
proc expectIdentifier(inputS: var InputStream): string {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from inputS and check that it is an identifier. Returns the name of the identifier. 
proc expectKeywords(inputS: var InputStream; inputKeywords: seq[KeywordEnum]): KeywordEnum {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from inputS and check that is one of the kewywords in KeywordEnum. Returns the keyword as a KeywordEnum object. 
proc expectNumber(inputS: var InputStream; scene: Scene): float {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError, KeyError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from inputS and check that it is either a literal number or a variable in scene. Returns the number as a float. 
proc expectString(inputS: var InputStream): string {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from inputS and check that is a literalString 
proc expectSymbol(inputS: var InputStream; sym: char) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from inputS and check that it matches symbol

proc readToken(inputS: var InputStream): Token {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, GrammarError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Reads a token from the stream. Raises GrammarError if a lexical error is found 
proc skipWhiteSpAndComments(inputS: var InputStream) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Keeps reading characters until a non-whitespace/non-comment character is found 
proc unreadChar(inputS: var InputStream; ch: char) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Pushes a character back to the stream 
proc unreadToken(inputS: var InputStream; token: Token) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

proc updatePos(inputS: var InputStream; ch: char) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
